definitions: To recover from an illness or an unpleasant experience.
To overcome a problem or difficulty.
To accept an unpleasant fact or situation after being upset by it.
To communicate or explain something successfully.
examples: It took her a long time to get over the flu.
He's finding it hard to get over his ex-girlfriend.
We need to get over this hurdle to finish the project.
I couldn't get over how rude he was.
She tried to get her point over to the audience.
pastTenses: got over sth, gotten over sth
